1. Overall Architecture Frontend (React) ● User uploads materials: ○ PDF, Text, Image ● User inputs intention/prompt (what type of cheatsheet they want) ● User selects template: ○ Definition focus ○ Example based ○ Formula-based ○ Mixed type ● Display preview of the generated cheatsheet ● Option to download as PDF (single/double A4) Backend ● Handle file uploads ● Convert inputs to machine-readable text: ○ PDF → text ○ Image → OCR → text ● Preprocess text (cleaning, chunking) ● Generate cheatsheet content based on: ○ User prompt/intention ○ Template ● Postprocess for formatting: ○ Optimize for A4 layout, font size, readability ● Return generated PDF to frontend 2. Input Processing PDF → Text ● Tools/libraries: ○ Python: pdfminer.six, PyMuPDF (fast, accurate) ○ Node.js: pdf-parse ● Extract clean text, maintain headings if possible for structure Image → Text (OCR) ● Tools: ○ Tesseract.js (JS) or pytesseract (Python) ○ For better accuracy: use OpenAI’s OCR via Vision API or Google Cloud Vision API Text ● Directly accept text input ● Preprocess: ○ Remove line breaks ○ Normalize whitespace ○ Detect headings/subheadings 3. Content Generation ● Options: ○ OpenAI API (GPT-4/ChatGPT) ■ Send cleaned text + user intention + template ■ Prompt engineering: “Summarize into A4 cheat sheet style, focusing on X template.” ○ Local LLM (if no API) – smaller, open-source: ■ LLaMA-2, MPT, GPT4All ■ Could be fine for small texts 1. Prompt ideas: Given the following study material: {text} 2. Goal: Generate a single A4 cheatsheet 3. Template: {template_type} 4. Focus: {user_intention} 5. Requirements: readable, concise, highlight formulas/examples/definitions ● ● Optional post-processing: ○ Chunk text into sections ○ Ensure important formulas are highlighted ○ Limit content to fit A4 (max words ~800-1000 per page) ○ Summarization if text too long 4. Layout / PDF Generation Tools ● Frontend JS PDF: jsPDF, react-pdf ● Backend PDF: pdfkit (Node), WeasyPrint (Python) ● CSS for PDF layout: 1. Single/double column 2. Font size scaling based on text length 3. Highlight boxes for formulas/examples ● Approach: 1. Generate structured HTML/JSX in React 2. Convert to PDF using react-pdf or html-to-pdf 3. Allow “preview” in browser before download 5. React Frontend Components ● UploadInput → accepts PDF, text, image ● PromptInput → text box or pre-defined intents ● TemplateSelector → dropdown ● Preview → shows cheatsheet in real time ● DownloadButton → generates PDF ● Optional progress loader for API calls 6. Backend / API Endpoints ● POST /upload → receives file, returns extracted text ● POST /generate → receives text + template + prompt → returns cheatsheet content ● GET /download → returns PDF Tech stack: ● Node.js + Express (easy React integration) ● Python Flask/FastAPI (better for PDF, OCR, AI integration) ● File storage: local for prototype; S3 for production 7. Optimization Tips ● Content fit for A4: ○ Use summarization if input is too long ○ Chunk and rank by relevance ● Readability: ○ Use bullet points ○ Highlight keywords, definitions, formulas ○ Use consistent heading hierarchy ● Performance: ○ Preprocess text to remove unnecessary content ○ Cache repeated PDF generation for same input 8. Shortcut / Rapid Prototyping ● Use pre-built tools: ○ PDF → Text: pdf-parse or PyMuPDF ○ Image → Text: Tesseract.js ○ Content generation: OpenAI GPT API ○ PDF export: react-pdf (good enough for layout) ● Don’t reinvent OCR or summarization; rely on API/OSS ● Focus first on: ○ Upload → Extract → Generate → Preview → Download flow ○ Then polish template formatting 9. restriction: The size of each page should be of the format of one A4(8.27 × 11.69 in). There should be 2 pages of maximum pages allowed. The content should be prioritized in the cheatsheet should be examples. The following features of the crib sheet should make the sheet more comfortable to use, and should be prioritized: Compact, dense information in small text. The overall layout style should be Free-form notes and sketches. The font size used in the cheatsheet should be in the Medium (11-12 pt) range to ensure readability and efficiency.
